data.title: Exencial Wealth Advisors
data.meta_description: At Exencial Wealth Advisors, our team of financial professionals have the expertise & dedication to help you achieve both your financial & personal goals.
data.text:
Ada M. Cartright, CPA/PFS joined Exencial Wealth Advisors in April 2016. She and the San Antonio tax team work as part of Exencial’s regional tax team working closely with the account managers and clients to provide clients excellent tax services and consulting.

After being a stay-at-home mom for a few years, Ada re-entered the accounting world as an integral part of a tax preparation and consulting team. Ada has been a CPA practicing at local firms for 15 plus years. Her experience includes working with high net-worth individuals and their related trusts, as well their businesses set up as corporations and partnerships. She recently obtained her AICPA sponsored PFS designation to better serve the client needs.

Ada attended Texas A & M University in College Station, Texas and graduated with a BBA in Accounting. She lives in San Antonio, TX with her husband, Mike, and two of their four children, Zoee and Tony. Their adult children, Travis and Dylan, live nearby in the San Antonio area. Ada enjoys spending time with family and friends, participating in church and other volunteer activities, Yoga, reading and a variety of creative outlets, such as photography and jewelry design.

PFS – The PFS designation is a financial planning credential awarded by the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants (“AICPA”) to individuals who satisfy its professional, work experience and educational requirements. Recipients of the PFS designation are required to be Certified Public Accountants (“CPAs”), maintain AICPA membership, have completed at least 80 hours of personal financial planning education, have at least two years of financial planning related business or teaching experience, and have passed the Personal Financial Planning examination. In order to maintain an ac tive PFS credential, holders must remain in good standing with the AICPA, retain a valid and unrevoked CPA certificate and complete 60 hours of financial planning related continuing education every three years.

Hi, I’m Alex Klingelhoeffer, an intergenerational wealth management expert here at Exencial Wealth Advisors. I work with successful business owners and families that want to live comfortably on their accumulated wealth, and pass those assets and values on to the next generation. For example, most business owners are laser-focused on growing their business but don’t have enough time to ensure their familial financial goals are met and portfolio is firing on all cylinders. At Exencial we’ve developed a unique process called E3 to take the stress and complexity of family finances and translate them into strategies for success that can help our clients spend their time and energy on the parts of life that they find meaningful. In our experience these solutions radically reduce the amount of time and mental energy our clients spend worrying about finances and empower them to live the lives of their dreams.

As for my story, after graduating from the University of Missouri, I began my career at Charles Schwab in Austin, TX. While at Schwab, I assisted retirement plan participants, executives, and business owners optimize their company provided benefits plans while earning my Chartered Financial Analyst and Certified Financial Planner designations. In 2019 I joined Exencial and moved to Oklahoma City to expand my practice and help clients as a fiduciary with wholistic, unbiased advice that can only come from working with an independent firm. I live in Edmond with my wife Selena and son Nicholas, where I’m a member of Rose Creek Golf Club and the CFA society of Oklahoma. If you’re at the point in your life where you need a specialist in investment management, retirement planning, or tax and estate planning, feel free to schedule a call below to see if there’s good alignment between our team and your family needs.

Ami Black recently just joined the investment team at Exencial Wealth Advisors. She is very excited and grateful to get the opportunity to work with and learn from investment officers and advisors that have the clients’ best interests. She recently made the transition from trading electricity in the Real Time Power Markets to trading securities in the Financial Markets.

Ami was born in Oklahoma City Oklahoma, and grew up here all the way through high school. She was recruited to play soccer for a NAIA school in Rome Georgia, named Berry College. Ami was fortunate enough to be a member of the 1993 NAIA Women’s National Championship Team, and named in 1996 NAIA Women’s Soccer Player of the Year. She received an excellent education at Berry College, with a BS in Business Management and a Masters in Business Administration, as well.

Ami has two glorious sons, Christian and Max. They keep her on her toes! She loves God, the Church and spending time with her family. She coaches youth soccer and leads a women’s life group when she is not at work.

Amy joined Exencial in November 2020 and leads the Tax services team for our North Carolina and Connecticut offices. She works closely with investment advisors and manages tax compliance and planning for tax clients. She is a CPA with a background in both public and private accounting. Her accounting career began in private accounting. She worked primarily with real estate investment firms in roles ranging from Staff Accountant to CFO, focusing on financial reporting. In 2010, her career shifted to accounting, tax planning, and tax compliance for high-net-worth families, and their closely held businesses and trusts.

She enjoys building and maintaining strong relationships with her clients. She assists clients with their tax planning and compliance needs, with an emphasis on developing strategies to help minimize income taxes. Amy graduated with honors from Texas Tech University with a BBA in Accounting and is a member of the AICPA and the Texas Society of CPAs.

Amy lives in Dallas, TX and has two children. Her son is in high school, and her daughter attends Texas Tech University. She enjoys attending live music events, spending time with family and friends, and traveling with her children.

Ashley Patterson joined Exencial Wealth Advisors in October 2016. She has more than fourteen years of experience as a Tax Administrator in the accounting and financial services industry. As a tax administrator, Ashley excels in assisting clients, creating efficient work processes, processing returns, and staying organized, but it is her consistently uplifting attitude that makes her an invaluable part of the tax team.

Ashley holds an undergraduate from the University of North Texas in Psychology. She currently resides in Denton, Texas with her husband and three children, Jayce, Braelyn, and Coy. She and her husband are avid Texas sports fans, and support the Texas Rangers by attending multiple games throughout the summer. Together with her family, she enjoys family lake days and spending time with extended family and friends.

Austin Winsett, CPA joined Exencial in March of 2018. He works with advisor team to deliver wealth planning services to clients. He collaborates and serves as a conduit between the investment and tax team in developing solutions for complex tax, estate, retirement, and investment issues. Austin always had a passion for investment and financial planning. He enjoys working directly with clients and helping them live fulfilled lives

Austin graduated from the University of Oklahoma with a Masters degree in Accounting. Upon Graduation, he spent several years at KPMG where he focused on attestation services for alternative investments and private equity funds. He obtained his CPA license in 2016. Austin is a member of the American Institute of CPAs and Texas Society of CPAs.

Outside of the office, he enjoys spending time with friends and family, cooking, and being outdoors for a run or round of golf.

Brendan is a Partner and Senior Wealth Advisor at EWA. Prior to the merger of SFA and EWA, Brendan founded SFA in 1996. This followed a career practicing public accounting and estate and wealth planning in Boston and New Haven. He has over thirty-six years of experience guiding clients to financial independence. As a fiduciary, he focuses on providing personal financial planning, individualized tax and estate planning and investment management.

Brendan has B.S. in Accounting from Boston College and a M.S. in Taxation and Estate Planning from Bentley College. He began his career as a Certified Public Accountant with Arthur Andersen.

Brendan and his wife, Susan, reside in Branford, Connecticut and have two grown children, Sam and Emma. He enjoys his time outdoors, traveling, boating, and fishing on Long Island Sound. He has summited 48 highest peaks in New Hampshire.

Brennon is a seasoned Senior Trader with over seven years of experience in the financial services industry. He holds a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration from UNC Charlotte’s Belk School of Business and an MBA in Finance from UNC-Wilmington’s Cameron School of Business. Brennon joined Exencial after gaining experience with Wells Fargo and Vanguard in Charlotte, NC. He brings strong attention to detail and a focus on client prosperity to our team. As a child, he thrived on understanding banking and finances, and with a savers mentality his goal is for every client to reach financial security and success.

Brennon’s passion for finance is matched only by his love for exploration. When not in the office he can be found traveling to new destinations, exploring the oceans scuba diving, and hitting the links as an avid golfer.

Bryan joined Exencial in June of 2022. He helps our clients to grow, protect, and transfer the wealth our clients build over their lifetime to the next generation, along with the values that built that family wealth. His passion is to make sure our clients can retire comfortably and build a lasting legacy that will last for generations. He particularly has a soft spot for business owners, as his family built a business from scratch in 1970 and ran it successfully until they decided to sell the business and retire comfortably in 2019.

He earned his Bachelor’s degree in Finance from Azusa Pacific University in 2010. After graduating, he worked in the mortgage industry for five years helping families to get into a home they could call their own. After this, he decided to move into his first love of financial advising and wealth management, and after four years in the industry, made the move to Exencial.

Outside of work he and his wife enjoy attending sporting events for the Los Angeles Dodgers, and the Los Angeles Kings. He also enjoys card and board games, and is a bit of a movie buff.

Overview

Caleb Dillard is the husband (8yrs) of Gina Dillard and the father of two full-of-life boys—Carson (4yo) and Jackson (1.5yo). He has been the COO of Exencial Wealth Advisors for almost six years and the CCO for three years cumulatively. His responsibilities include overseeing the day-to-day execution of the firm, leading the firm’s leadership team, and overseeing special projects for the firm. He is a CFA Charterholder; a graduate of East Central University in Ada, Oklahoma; and a member of Exencial’s Board.

History with Exencial Wealth Advisors

In 2015, Caleb left his Associate Wealth Advisor position with another firm and joined Exencial as a trader to actively participate in portfolio management and the Investment Committee. It was generally a step down from his previous positions, but working at a firm with the noble cause of always doing the right thing for clients was of the utmost importance to him. In his trader position, he streamlined reporting and analysis with programming while completing exams to earn the designation of CFA Charterholder, a leading industry designation. He then shifted toward more core business improvements and then, in 2017, became COO, where he started leading larger teams and improvements for the firm.

Throughout his tenure with Exencial, Exencial has made several acquisitions, more than doubled firm revenue, expanded to four new states, and expanded its tax services and investment team.

Caleb is constantly improving himself through his own experiences, the experiences of others, study groups, conferences, podcasts, webinars, and books.

Additional Background

Further in his background, Caleb spent seven years in banking, with his most recent position being Loan Officer; he flipped four houses and managed his own portfolio. He grew up in Ada, Oklahoma, in a family of six children.

Hobbies and Interests

Caleb loves spending time with his family and enjoys “the little things.” Before having children, he was an avid skeet shooter, hunter, and fisher; now, he is a cook and avid reader. He is a Christian and enjoys serving the Church and community together as a family.

Favorite Books

Atomic Habits by James Clear [Self Improvement]

The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People by Stephen Covey [Self Improvement]

Rocket Fuel by Gino Wickman and Mark C. Winters [Business]

The Goal by Eliyahu Goldratt [Business]

The Stormlight Archives by Brandon Sanderson [Fantasy]

Chris Meeks, CPA joined Exencial Wealth Advisors in September of 2021. Prior to joining Exencial, Chris worked as a CPA for more than ten years for both local and national firms. Chris has a comprehensive and diverse background in tax compliance, planning, and tax controversy at the international, federal, state, and local levels. Chris’s main focus over the last several years has been assisting high net worth families and closely-held family businesses with their tax planning needs.

Chris has a passion for developing relationships with his clients, small or large. He has a track record of helping clients to grow their small businesses in the most tax-advantageous manner possible. Chris is a member of the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants, the Texas Society of Certified Public Accountants, the San Antonio CPA Society, and previously served on the board of the TSCPA State Taxation Committee. Chris graduated Magna Cum Laude from the University of the Incarnate Word with a BBA in Accounting. Chris lives in San Antonio, Texas with his wife and three children.

Craig is a seasoned financial professional who has over 23 years of experience. He received his Masters in Business Administration in Finance from University of New Haven in 2004. Craig received his undergraduate degree in Finance, with a minor in Psychology, from Bryant University in 1997.

Prior to joining Exencial Wealth Advisors, Craig worked for Fisher Investments, Fidelity Investments and Ameriprise. He began his career at Ameriprise, where he spent 9 years in various financial and management roles. He then joined Fidelity Investments, where he spent 8 years. His most recent role was as a Vice President, Senior Account Executive managing $1.5 billion for over 400 families. During his tenure at Fidelity, Craig was the recipient of the Fidelity Achiever Award, awarded to him multiple years. This award is one of Fidelity’s highest recognition awards.

Craig has spent the majority of his career helping individual clients meet their financial goals and achieve financial freedom. He will explain Exencial Wealth Advisors’s approach and how it compares to other money management options currently available to you. Craig will review your current financial situation, discuss your personal investment goals and objectives, and help determine how Exencial Wealth Advisors can best benefit you.

In his spare time, Craig enjoys spending time with his wife, son and daughter. Craig is an avid outdoorsman and loves to give back to his community. Some of his hobbies include spending valuable family time doing the following: golfing, fishing, camping, and boating.

Crystal is a Florida native who started her financial services career in 1999. With over 22 years of diverse experience, Crystal worked as an Operations Manager for a broker-dealer in California, a Financial Services Rep for the Bank of Hawaii, and later partnered with the Branch Manager of a top Financial Advisor at Morgan Stanley. Due to her vast experience with affluent families, Crystal developed an extensive understanding of clients transitioning in various stages of their lives. Crystal is always willing to go above and beyond to reach excellence and thrives on servicing existing clients with extraordinarily high standards.

Crystal studied at St Petersburg College and furthered her education with a study abroad program. She earned an Associate Degree and graduated on the Dean’s List with Honors. She currently holds her Series 66 licenses, 2-15 Life, Health, and Variable Annuities License, and a Financial Planning Associate designation.

Dave is driven by his desire and passion to help others achieve financial independence by offering objective and unbiased financial advice to those who are committed to achieving financial freedom in their own lives. He works closely with each of his clients to develop a customized financial strategy by utilizing a simple-to-understand process called the E3 Formula. With this process all of the pieces of the financial puzzle come together as economic or lifestyle needs change.

As a former 26 year Fortune 100 telecom professional Dave worked with business owners and executives developing strategies to improve their bottom line. Throughout his career he has always been known as an astute numbers guy. His successful management areas of expertise included roles in marketing, finance and sales operations where he applied strategic planning skills to drive results. His diverse background and training bring decades of experience and knowledge to his role at Exencial Wealth Advisors enabling him to provide expert wealth planning services for his clients to realize their own individual financial goals.

Dave is a CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNERTM professional and holds a Life and Health insurance license in the State of Texas. Dave earned his Bachelor of Business Administration and Masters of Business Administration degrees from West Texas A&M University. Completed CFP educational requirements at SMU, Dallas, TX. As a CFP® professional you can be sure that Dave provides expert and professional financial planning services. To earn a CFP designation, Dave had to complete an approved educational program, pass a rigorous examination and meet stringent experience requirements. Dave also adheres to a professional Code of Ethics and he fulfills annual continuing education requirements to remain aware of current planning strategies and financial trends.

Dave and his wife, Ginny Totah, have lived in Plano, Texas since 1994. Dave enjoys the outdoors, golf, skiing and cars. Dave is also an active member of the Financial Planning Association of DFW.

CFP – The CFP® certification is a financial planning credential awarded by the Certified Financial Planner Board of Standards Inc. (the “CFP Board”) to individuals who meet its education, examination, experience and ethics requirements. Eligible candidates are generally required to have three years of financial planning related experience and possess a bachelor’s degree from an accredited U.S. college or university. Certificants are further required to complete a CFP Board-Registered Education Program (or possess a qualifying professional credential), clear a personal and professional background check, and pass the CFP® Certification Examination, a six-hour multiple choice exam divided into two separate sessions. In order to maintain the certification, CFP® designees must also complete at least 30 hours of continuing education every two years on an ongoing basis.

Delia Garcia joined Exencial Wealth Advisors in April 2016 after working with Netting & Pace, CPAs since 2005. Delia has taken courses in tax preparation and will assist when needed. She has been in the investment management field for over 20 years and tax assembly for over 10 years.

Delia is devoted to helping our clients; many of them know her by name and see her as our contact person for most of our tax questions. She takes great pride in helping our clients and takes every opportunity as a learning experience.

Delia has 3 children and 6 grandchildren that she loves spending time with. They range from ages 4 to 18 years old. She spends a lot of quality time with her mother who keeps her very busy. She loves reading and arts & crafts which she enjoys with her mother.

“Enjoy your life each and every day. You can do anything, if you put your mind to it.”

From the time Don Pace graduated from high school, he knew he wanted to be part of the best. His determination for success and drive to perfection has made him one of the most sought-after financial and tax planners in South Texas.

After many years, he and his partner Conrad Netting together had grown their wealth management company, Netting & Pace, CPAs, into one of South Texas’ premiere investment, financial and tax planning organizations and now joined Exencial to continue the legacy.

With a lifelong interest in investing, finance and tax, Pace built his career at some of the most prestigious accounting firms in the country, including Ernst & Whinney (now Ernst & Young).

Pace is a former U.S. Marine and holds a master of public accounting and a bachelor of science in civil engineering, both from The University of Texas at Austin. He is a Certified Public Accountant and a Personal Financial Specialist with a Series 65 license.

Pace is a husband, father, amateur photographer and an avid cyclist. He has volunteered and lectured on behalf of numerous civic and professional organizations, with his most gratifying experience as a volunteer instructor for San Antonio’s Junior Achievement Program.

PFS – The PFS designation is a financial planning credential awarded by the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants (“AICPA”) to individuals who satisfy its professional, work experience and educational requirements. Recipients of the PFS designation are required to be Certified Public Accountants (“CPAs”), maintain AICPA membership, have completed at least 80 hours of personal financial planning education, have at least two years of financial planning related business or teaching experience, and have passed the Personal Financial Planning examination. In order to maintain an ac tive PFS credential, holders must remain in good standing with the AICPA, retain a valid and unrevoked CPA certificate and complete 60 hours of financial planning related continuing education every three years.

Jim joined Exencial Wealth Advisors in 2020 when the firm merged with Willingdon Wealth Management where he was a Partner. Jim has over 20 years of investment experience which began in 1996 at Interstate/Johnson Lane where he served multiple roles. In 1999, Jim began working with Portfolio Capital Management where he was a Partner, Senior Wealth Advisor, and Chief Compliance Officer. In 2016, Portfolio Capital Management merged with Willingdon Wealth Management where Jim continued his role as a Senior Wealth Advisor. He is also a veteran of the United States Navy.

Jim is a graduate of Youngstown State University with a BSBA degree. He also has earned the professional designation of Certified Financial Planner™ and is a member of the Charlotte Chapter of the Financial Planners Association.

As a Senior Wealth Advisor, Jim enjoys helping clients identify and accomplish their financial goals and objectives.

Jim and his wife, Kristy, are active within their community primarily through their church. Jim and Kristy have four children and four grandchildren.

Jared Snider’s background is in financial planning, estate planning and real estate law, and banking. Before joining Exencial Wealth Advisors, Jared served as an advisor for another financial planning firm where he developed client financial plans and advised clients. During his law practice, Jared represented financial institutions and investors in real estate transactions and litigation. He also guided clients through the estate planning process and represented clients in probate cases. During his time in banking, Jared served as a business banker and managed the bank’s merchant services accounts.

Jared graduated with highest honors from The University of Tulsa College of Law and was honored as a member of the Order of the Curule Chair and as managing editor of Tulsa Law Review. Jared earned his undergraduate degree from Oral Roberts University and graduated summa cum laude, having double majored in Business Administration and Music Composition.

Jared and his wife, Lindsey, have a daughter, Brooklyn, and a dog, Frisco. Jared plays guitar and saxophone and also sings. The Sniders are Texas Rangers and Dallas Cowboys fans and love to travel and enjoy the outdoors. They are also active in their local church.

Jasen Wallace is a CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNER™ professional who helps clients answer some of life’s biggest financial questions like: ‘How should I save for retirement?’ or ‘Should I pay off my debt or invest first?’ or ‘What’s the most suitable way for me to pay for my kid’s education?’ and ‘When is the most suitable time for me to take my Social Security?’

Jasen has worked over half a decade with both young professionals and those nearing or in retirement. Each have their own challenges that our firm is well equipped to handle.

Jasen earned his Masters Degree in Financial Planning from Texas Tech University, a Graduate Certificate in Charitable Planning, and passed the CFP® exam in 2012.

Jasen enjoys running, rock climbing, live comedy and music with his wife, Brandi.

Jean Wilczynski, CFP® is a financial advisor in our Connecticut office. She helps individuals and families achieve their most important financial goals.

Jean is a Coast Guard veteran with experience in financial management as well as investor and public relations for public and private companies. She also spent a number of years in the nonprofit sector working as a writer and communications director.

Jean holds a bachelor’s degree in Mathematical Science from the U.S. Coast Guard Academy and a MBA from The George Washington University. She earned the Certified Financial Planner™ (CFP®) designation in 2017.

Jean and her husband Vince live in Old Lyme, Connecticut, and are active in the local community. Jean serves as Treasurer of the local Board of Education and both volunteer with several nonprofit organizations, including the local high school FIRST Robotics team. They have three sons: Peter, a product manager and software engineer; Tim, an automation engineer; and Pat, a mechanical engineer working in product development and testing. Jean and Vince enjoy gardening, running, fishing (not necessarily in that order) and traveling to visit their sons and extended family.

Jeff joined Exencial Wealth Advisors as a Senior Portfolio Manager for Fixed Income and became the Director of Portfolio Management in 2022. He brings an extensive fixed income background and over 20 years of experience in the investment management industry.

Previous to joining Exencial, Jeff was a Portfolio Manager for 11 years on the Core Fixed Income Team for Columbia Threadneedle Investments, managing portfolios for high-net-worth and institutional clients. Prior to his fixed income role, Jeff was the Institutional Performance Measurement Manager for a predecessor organization of Columbia Threadneedle, where he was responsible for managing performance reporting and attribution analysis across all investment platforms. Jeff began his career as a Performance Measurement Service Manager at Infovisa, Inc.

Jeff received a B.S. in Business Administration from Nebraska Wesleyan University, where he graduated with high distinction. Jeff holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation and is a member of the CFA North Carolina Society.

Jeff and his wife, April, have two daughters and are active in their community primarily through their church and support of the Ada Jenkins Center, a not-for-profit organization helping those in poverty gain economic independence.

Co-Founder Jerry Georgopoulos has spent his entire career in the financial advisory field counseling senior executives on comprehensive financial planning. He began his career in 1995 with The Ayco Company, LP, a Goldman Sachs Company, where he served senior executives with distinction at numerous Fortune 500 Companies. He joined KPMG to develop their employer sponsored executive financial planning program in the southwest and western regions. He then founded Executive Financial Group, a firm that continues to specialize in counseling corporate executives today as Exencial Wealth Advisors.

Jerry graduated from Villanova University in 1992 with a Bachelor of Science in Accountancy and from Villanova School of Law where he earned his Juris Doctor in 1995. He also enlisted for three years in the United States Army, where he later received his commission as a 2nd Lieutenant in the Army Reserve as an Infantry officer.

Jerry and, his wife, D’Ann live in Corsicana.

John Brown joined Exencial in August 2017. For the prior 19 years he was an Investment Advisor at Bush O’Donnell in St. Louis, where he held various positions and managed concentrated portfolios of large-cap stocks and MLPs. John is excited to add his investment and estate planning skills to the Exencial team. Earlier in his career, John spent ten years at the Petrolite Corporation working with refinery process chemicals and fuel additives, and three years at Maritz Travel Company as a Travel Director. He currently serves as the Chairman of Gross & Janes railroad crosstie company, and as a board member of Exegy, Inc.

John holds an MBA from Washington University and a BA from Pomona College. He and his wife Amy currently reside in Dallas, and have two grown children in the Dallas/Fort Worth area and a third in New York City.

John Burns is the CEO of Exencial Wealth Advisors, a leading provider of fee-only, objective investment management and financial planning services to individuals, families, corporate executives, and business owners all over the country. The firm also serves as a fiduciary for institutional-level clients and corporate and municipal retirement plans.

Exencial, which employs more than 95 individuals and manages approximately $4.2 billion in total assets, is one of the fastest-growing firms in the United States (as named by Financial Advisor Magazine) and has been listed as one of the country’s top independent RIA firms by the Financial Times. Exencial currently has offices in Oklahoma City, Old Lyme, CT, San Antonio, North Carolina, and Frisco, Texas.

The firm and its experts are regularly called upon for speaking engagements, including panels at major industry conferences hosted by national organizations.

Additionally, John and his colleagues are frequently in the news, having been featured on CNBC and Fox Business, as well as quoted in national publications such as The Wall Street Journal, U.S. News & World Report, CNNMoney and Bloomberg.

John himself has 30+ years of industry experience. One of his initiatives at Exencial has been to attract, retain and mold the next generation of talent to ensure clients will receive a consistent, high level of service for years to come.

In addition to his role leading Exencial, he is a founding member of aRIA, the alliance for RIAs, a boutique industry association of six elite RIA firms offering insight for advisors to enhance their firms’ enterprise value.

He earned a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration from the University of Oklahoma in 1986. He attained the Certified Financial Planner™ (CFP®) designation in 1992 and serves as a member of the Financial Planning Association on a local and national level.

John and his wife, Melanie, split their time between Oklahoma City and Dallas. Children and Grandchildren include: Jake, Ashton, and grandson River, who live in Dallas and works in commercial real estate; Murphy, who lives in Dallas and works for Exencial Wealth Advisors and Mitchell (1996 -2023).

Julia A. Ellingwood, CPA joined Exencial Wealth Advisors in April 2016, having previously been with Netting and Pace, CPAs since 2013. She works with the San Antonio tax team to provide clients with excellent tax and consulting services. A CPA since 2005, Julia is licensed in both Texas and Washington. Julia attended Kent State University in Kent, OH, graduating with a Business Administration degree. She completed a graduate-level accounting certificate at the University of Washington in Seattle. She has passed the AICPA sponsored PFS (Personal Financial Specialist) exam, and is working on completing the required financial planning hours to earn the credential.

She enjoys reading, music, and spending time with her family.

PFS – The PFS designation is a financial planning credential awarded by the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants (“AICPA”) to individuals who satisfy its professional, work experience and educational requirements. Recipients of the PFS designation are required to be Certified Public Accountants (“CPAs”), maintain AICPA membership, have completed at least 80 hours of personal financial planning education, have at least two years of financial planning related business or teaching experience, and have passed the Personal Financial Planning examination. In order to maintain an ac tive PFS credential, holders must remain in good standing with the AICPA, retain a valid and unrevoked CPA certificate and complete 60 hours of financial planning related continuing education every three years.

Julie Cavanaugh joined Exencial Wealth Advisors in April 2016 after working with Netting & Pace, CPAs since 2007. She is the branch manager for our San Antonio office. Julie graduated from the University of Texas at Austin with a Bachelors of Business Administration in Marketing and Management. She brings with her 30 plus year of experience in banking and financial services.

Julie is devoted to providing excellent client service and lifting financial worries for the clients. She sees helping clients as more of her mission than a job.

Julie is married with two children and four delightful grandchildren. She enjoys spending time with family, participating in church and volunteering. You will find her most weekends at the lake on a jet ski or boating.

Karen Boschert is a wealth planning professional with over 17 years of experience in the financial services industry. Prior to joining Exencial Wealth Advisors in 2018, Karen worked for Fidelity Investments for over nine years as a Director, Retirement Planner, and Account Executive. She also worked with TD Ameritrade as a Private Client Investment Consultant. Karen obtained her Chartered Retirement Planning Counselor (CRPC®) designation in 2016 and has extensive experience with holistic financial planning, working with families to identify and implement strategies that meet their unique needs and objectives. The financial planning process involves providing solutions that include investment guidance, retirement income strategies, and general wealth and legacy planning.

Prior to her career in finance, Karen graduated in 2003 from Xavier University in Cincinnati, OH with her Bachelor of Arts. Giving back to the community is important to Karen. She has worked for a non-profit organization in Cincinnati, OH as a grant writer and fundraiser, and she also manages a scholarship fund in her family’s name for Elder High School in Cincinnati. Karen enjoys playing pickleball and reading in her free time.

Kaye is a wealth planning professional with over 15 years of experience in the financial services industry. Before joining Exencial Wealth Advisors in 2017, she worked for TIAA-CREF’s Individual Advisory Services and at Ameriprise Financial as both a Registered Support Assistant and a Financial Advisor. Kaye has extensive experience with holistic financial planning and works with clients to identify and implement strategies that meet their unique needs and objectives. This financial planning process involves providing solutions that include investment guidance, retirement income strategies, and generational wealth and legacy planning.

Prior to her career in finance, Kaye graduated from Ithaca College in 2006 with a degree in Sport Management and a minor in Business Finance. She worked for the Baltimore Ravens immediately following graduation and also completed an internship with the United States Olympic Committee. Kaye is still a passionate sports fan, traveling regularly during the summer months to compete and coach the growing sport of beach volleyball. She resides in Huntersville, NC with her husband, Verun and their son, Julian.

Kristin Carlton, CFP® joined Exencial Wealth Advisors in April 2016 and works in our San Antonio office. Before becoming an employee with Exencial, she was the Senior Financial Planner at Netting & Pace, CPAs for eleven years. Kristin graduated from The University of Texas in San Antonio in 2005 with a BBA in both Finance and Business Management. She is a CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNERTM and obtained her Series 65 license.

Kristin enjoys meeting with clients and learning more about them, their families and their personal and financial goals. In addition to her experience working with high-net worth clients, Kristin also enjoys working with Millennials, newlyweds or other young professionals looking to enhance their financial knowledge and begin planning for their future.

Kristin is an active member of the San Antonio Estate Planners Council and the Financial Planning Association.

Kyle graduated from Purdue University with a degree in Business Management and Finance in 2007. After an initial search for a corporate finance job, he found an opportunity with a national planning firm that offered financial, estate and business planning services to High Net Worth families. The complexities and problem solving for families and small business owners were a natural fit. He quickly found that the relationships he built with his clients afforded him an opportunity to constantly learn and provide evolving solutions that could dramatically impact a family’s lives, over multiple generations, in a positive manner. After 11 years with his previous firm, Kyle joined Exencial in 2019, eager to broaden the scope of services that he could offer to clients.

With him, Kyle brings a collaborative process that pulls together all of the members and elements of a client’s planning team including their attorneys, CPAs and financial professionals. Part of his journey with advisors and their clients is to prepare everyone for the financial and technical considerations for their existing and future planning. It is imperative that we not only put the correct planning structure in place for a family, but that we also oversee and assist with the ongoing maintenance of their estate and help them understand the multitude of the different key persons, roles and responsibilities associated with their planning and documents.

Together we strive to create and structure various integrated planning strategies that preserve and transfer wealth for our families. Our aim is to simplify what is often a complex and comprehensive recommendation to our clients but also give them the comfort in understanding we have taken a great deal more into consideration than just our end solution. Integrating multiple complex strategies with respect to family, business, charitable and tax planning is our expertise.

Matt brings several years of professional financial experience in understanding the financial and emotional issues behind helping to transition from acquiring wealth to help grow and protect that wealth. Deeply familiar with the emotional and financial challenges associated with transitioning wealth for executives, entrepreneurs and inheritors, among others, Matt seeks to understand each client’s current situation and goals and crafts a flexible and enduring financial, investment and risk management plan.

A graduate of Texas State University, Matt earned a B.B.A. in Finance in 1997 and is a CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNER™ professional. Travel is a special passion of his, and favorite destinations for the Weinheimer family include Costa Rica, Hawaii and Florida. In and around Austin and on the road, he enjoys mountain biking, fly fishing and scuba diving.

Michael joined Exencial Wealth Advisors in 2021 as a Senior Portfolio Manager for Fixed Income and brings over 20 years of experience in the investment management industry. Previous to joining Exencial, Michael was the Southeast Tax-Exempt Fixed Income Team Lead for Columbia Threadneedle Investments. Michael was also a Portfolio Manager for 14 years on the Tax-Exempt Fixed Income Team, managing individually tailored portfolios for high-net-worth clients. Prior to his Portfolio Manager role, Michael was a tax-exempt credit analyst covering various sectors. Michael began his professional career as a Mutual Fund Accountant at BISYS.

Michael received a B.S. in Business Administration with a concentration in Finance from The Ohio State University. Michael holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation and is a member of the CFA North Carolina Society.

Michael and his wife, Peggy, have two sons and a daughter. The family is active in Scouts BSA (formerly Boy Scouts of America) and supports the Paula Takacs Foundation, a not-for-profit organization that raises awareness and funds for sarcoma cancer research and clinical trials.

Michael joined Exencial Wealth Advisors in 2020 when the firm he owned, Bucks County Financial Planning Group, merged with Exencial. He is a fiduciary financial planner with over 20 years of experience who is trained as a tax attorney with a specialization in estate planning, trusts, investments, and business exit planning.

Mr. McGlashen earned his undergraduate degree from Temple University in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, graduating summa cum laude, and elected into Phi Beta Kappa. He received his Jurist Doctorate degree from the University of Florida College of Law, which is ranked as one of the top 25 law schools in the country by US News, 2020; ranked 3rd (tie) in 2020 in Tax; and their Estate Planning Certificate Program is nationally recognized. Mr. McGlashen qualified for the certificate and clerked for Florida’s 8th Judicial Circuit, Probate Division, while in law school. He then received certificates in Real Estate Development and Real Estate Finance from Massachusetts Institute of Technology’s Summer Real Estate Program, post doctorate. He is a Certified Exit Planning Advisor (CEPA) through the Exit Planning Institute.

Michael serves on the Board of Directors of Westlake Rotary Sunrise Foundation; he served as President of the Rotary Club of Westlake Village Sunrise, (2017/18) whose motto is “Where friends gather to have fun and do good in the world”.

He is a board member and Vice President of The Westlakers and a board member The Camarillo Healing Rooms, former President of La Reina High School’s PTA, former Chairman of the Board and President, House of Hope Post Prison Release, Camarillo, CA. He is President/Founding Member of the Westlake Village Chapter of la Chaine Rôtisseurs.

He is former Chairman of the Board of Auditors for Bensalem township, past board member of Bucks County Housing Finance Board, and elected four times to public office. He served in the U.S. Army Reserves as a Military Policeman from 1981 to 1987.

After traveling around the country for years and then going back to school for eight years, he came back to Pennsylvania and married the girl of his dreams, a girl from his hometown, Colleen Wagner.

Michael and Colleen have a sixteen-year-old daughter, Serena, with whom they enjoy monthly daddy/daughter days, Barnes & Noble days, riding dirt bikes, cooking, and gardening. The family’s motto is: we travel and have fun as a tribe and live to serve others. Love of Country Leads.

Murphy joined Exencial in 2020 as a Business Development Officer. Murphy began her career in sales and business development in 2014 with the Phoenix Suns and continued her success with the Dallas Mavericks. Her ability to listen and understand the big picture for her corporate clients garnered her the top sales executive position at both NBA franchises during her employment.

Murphy exited sports in 2017 when she was recruited by Dinova as Regional Director of Partnerships. Her main focus was with Fortune 500 executives and the U.S. Department of Defense to grow and expand their bottom line.

Murphy enjoys developing relationships with her clients and understanding what is important to them long term. She brings focus, discipline, positive energy, and a fresh perspective to Exencial’s wealth management platform.

Murphy is a graduate of Trinity University in San Antonio, Texas, and was a 2X All-American in Women’s Basketball. Murphy loves spending quality time with her family. She enjoys the outdoors, and has a passion for fitness and traveling.

Nancy Chapman joined Exencial Wealth Advisors in January 2020 as a seasonal CPA and became a full time in fall 2021 as a part of the tax team for the Frisco/OK region. She began her career in public accounting in 2015, working at small and regional sized firms. She worked on a variety of clients, industries and returns and take good care of clients with tax compliance and planning needs.

Nancy is a licensed CPA in Texas since 2016 and received her Bachelor’s degree of business Administration and Master’s degree in Accounting from University of Texas at Dallas. Nancy is a Member of the American Institute of CPA, Texas of CPA and the Dallas Chapter of CPA Society.

Nancy is active in the community and regularly volunteers in and around Plano, where she, her husband, twin babies and her Bichon Frise live. In her spare time, she enjoys international travel, learning other languages and spending time with friends and family and explore local hidden gems.

Norma Jean Nieto recently joined the team as a Tax Administrator.

She has Business Administration training with over twenty years of experience as administrative support, keeping pace with progressive technology software and applications.

She works closely with the tax director and tax associates providing support and encouragement, specializing in client data management.

Norma has three daughters and five grandchildren. They gather weekly for home cooked meals where they like to try new recipes. They especially enjoy going to local MiLB games where they can cheer on the home team. She also enjoys church activities, hand embroidering and nurturing her succulent garden.

Patrick is a Partner and Senior Wealth Advisor at EWA of CT. Patrick has been in the financial services industry since 1984, and prior to the merger with EWA, he was a partner at Shoreline Financial Advisors since 2001. Prior to SFA, he was a Senior Vice President and portfolio manager at Pioneer Investments. Before Pioneer, Patrick was a Vice President and portfolio manager at Loomis, Sayles & Co, and he began his career as a securities analyst at Putnam Investments.

Patrick has a B.B.A. from the University of Notre Dame and an M.S. in Finance from Boston College. He is a Chartered Financial Analyst and a member of CFA Institute and the New York Society of Security Analysts.

Besides summiting the 47 of the 48 highest peaks in New Hampshire with Brendan, Patrick enjoys boating, cycling, and traveling. He and his wife, Susanna, reside in Essex, Connecticut. They have two grown children, Katie and Nathan.

Pete joined Exencial Wealth Advisors in 2017 as a portfolio manager for the Enhanced Yield strategy. Prior to joining Willingdon, he was a research analyst for Horizon Investments where he focused on global equity research and supported the firm’s trading and performance reporting operations. Prior to Horizon Investments, Pete was a Market Risk analyst for Wells Fargo Securities. He began his career as an analyst for Liquid Credit Products at Bank of America.

Pete holds a BS in Finance and a BS in Economics from DePaul University where he graduated cum laude. He also holds an MBA from Duke University where he graduated in the top 10 percent of his class and was designated a Fuqua scholar. He is a CFA charterholder and a member of the CFA Society of North Carolina.

Pete received his Masters in Business Administration from Campbell University in 1998. He received his undergraduate degree in Trust Management and minor in Financial Planning from Campbell University in 1998, as well. Pete is a member of the American Bankers Association, and a Certified Trust and Financial Advisor. He is a member of the Charlotte Estate Planning Council and serves on the steering committee for Estate Planner’s Day at Queens University. Pete has also earned the professional designation of Certified Financial Planner™ and is a member of the Charlotte Chapter of the Financial Planners Association.

Pete spent 5 years with Bank of America’s Trust Department in Tampa, FL as an account opening coordinator and team leader. He spent an additional 3 years with Bank of America’s Wealth Management in Charlotte, NC as a local Trust Officer. Prior to joining Exencial Wealth Advisors, he spent the previous 3 years with First Charter Bank as a Trust Officer in Charlotte, NC.

Pete joined Exencial Wealth Advisors in February of 2009. His primary responsibilities include business development, customer service, estate planning and financial planning. Pete’s commitment to providing the highest level of personal service to our clients is an integral part of our future success.

Pete and his wife Leslie have four children, three daughters, Ava, Claire and Audrey and a son, Coleman.

Rusty Ross joined Exencial Wealth Advisors in 2012. He began his career at KPMG in Dallas, where he worked on tax compliance, planning, and research for alternative investments, private equity funds and large real estate investment partnerships. Rusty always had an interest in the investment and financial planning field, and his time servicing clients at Exencial solidified that it was a great fit. He enjoys working directly with clients to help achieve their Family, Occupation, Recreation and Money goals through tax, investment, and estate planning.

Rusty graduated from the University of Oklahoma with a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration and a Master of Accountancy in 2009. He gained his CPA license in 2011. Rusty is a member of the American Institute of CPAs, AICPA Tax, and AICPA Personal Financial Planning practice areas.

Rusty, his wife, Whitney, three children, Blair, Boyd, and Blythe, and dog Fletch live in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma. They attend and are involved with Christ the King Catholic Church and School. In his free time, Rusty enjoys spending time with his kids, playing golf, grilling, and watching college football.

Randy joined Exencial in August of 2020 as a Senior Portfolio Manager for the Core and International Strategies. Randy has an extensive background in global equites with over 20 years’ experience as an analyst and portfolio manager. Randy also has experience in client service partnering with both institutional and retail relationship managers.

Before Exencial, Randy was a Portfolio Manager and Analyst for 16 years on the Global Small Cap Team for Putnam Investments. Randy helped implement a structured investment process focusing on intrinsic value. During his tenure at Putnam Randy also developed and managed an apprentice program to train and develop junior analysts. Randy most recently comes from Westwood Global in Boston where he was a Senior Research Analyst focusing on an International Large Cap Strategy.

Randy has a Master of Science in Finance from Boston College and a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration from the University of Massachusetts at Lowell. Randy is a CFA charterholder.

Randy enjoys playing basketball on the weekends and spending time with his wife, Tina and children Marco and Francesca.

Taylor joined Exencial Wealth Advisors in 2019 as a Relationship Manager in our San Antonio office. Taylor previously worked as a tax preparer and bookkeeper for a local CPA firm starting in 2010. He moved into the financial services sector in 2014 while working as a financial planning intern for Netting & Pace CPAs.

After his internship ended, Taylor spent several years as the Client Services Manager for Sawtelle Financial Management and then worked for Alliance Bernstein as a Private Client Administrator.

Taylor attained his Series 65 license in 2020. He graduated with honors from the University of Texas at San Antonio in 2015 with a Bachelor of Business Administration degree in Management.

Outside of work, Taylor enjoys spending time with family and friends, cooking, riding his bike, and any outdoor activity involving water.

Tim Courtney serves as Chief Investment Officer of Exencial Wealth Advisors and chairs the investment committee. He attained the Certified Investment Management Analyst (CIMA) designation in 2005 and has more than 15 years of experience advising individuals, corporations and organizations on investments and markets, tax planning and retirement.

Much of Tim’s time is spent meeting with clients, formulating and advising on client strategies, and performing investment and portfolio research. Prior to Exencial, Tim worked for Fidelity Investments in Dallas, TX. He graduated from Oklahoma State University in 1994 with a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration.

Tim has shared his expertise as a guest on CNBC and FOX Business, and his research has been featured in The Wall Street Journal, Barron’s, AARP Magazine and elsewhere.

Tim is married to Jennifer and they live in Edmond with their four children: Ben, Abby, Susannah and Amelia. They enjoy traveling as a family and spending time participating in sports, such as tennis and volleyball.

CIMA – The CIMA® certification signifies that an individual has met initial and on-going experience, ethical, education, and examination requirements for investment management consulting, including advanced investment management theory and application. Prerequisites for the CIMA® certification are three years of financial services experience and an acceptable regulatory history. To obtain the CIMA® certification, candidates must pass an online Qualification Examination, successfully complete a one-week classroom education program provided by a Registered Education Provider at an AACSB accredited university business school, and pass an online Certification Examination. CIMA® designees are required to adhere to IMCA’s Code of Professional Responsibility, Standards of Practice, and Rules and Guidelines for Use of the Marks. CIMA® designees must report 40 hours of continuing education credits, including two ethics hours, every two years to maintain the certification. The designation is administered through Investment Management Consultants Association (IMCA®).

Tony utilizes nearly 15 years of experience in the financial services industry to help individuals and families navigate the complex decisions they face along their financial journey. He has a passion to serve, acting as their personal CFO, helping to prioritize and reach their goals in a thoughtful manner.

Tony started his career at Fidelity, serving their retail and institutional clients for nearly 5 years. He then spent the following 7 years with a national firm which taught him the benefit of offering a single source of advice as it pertains to tax and investment decisions, prior to joining Exencial in 2021.

His favorite aspect of working at Exencial is his ability to take that even further, utilizing the large team of experienced professionals, each an expert in their given arena, to provide expert guidance and a custom-tailored experience to each client across all the pillars of financial planning.

Tony graduated with a BBA in Finance from the University of Texas-San Antonio. He and his wife Jessica live in Irving, TX with their three children and Weimaraner, Boo. Beyond spending time with family, he enjoys grilling, fishing, golfing, and just about anything else outdoors.
